01DB59DA29194A32A31608E6593B8618.description: Library:  Students will verbalize how they intend to give God glory through the books they have chosen.

41D8D1B55BBF4864B8A98CF4DDA7E4EA.description: Library:  Students will evaluate Christian writings and allegories, such as Mere Christianity or The Shack, that emphasize the Holy Spirit’s work in guiding and transforming believers.

6BA278F3334C4D88B235185B27EF3866.description: Library:  Students will research and present the role of the Holy Spirit in Christian theology and how it has been represented in literature and art.

04DD7F153FC146B1B75DBB6FFF658C07.description: Library:  Students will study biblical texts about the Holy Spirit (e.g., John 16:13, 2 Corinthians 3:17-18) and reflect on their implications for a believer’s life.

377589582C70468C963DB6301AC565DD.description: Art::  Students will verbalize how they intend to give God glory through the art they have created.

EDCF33EAD8B24E25A08108A27AA7D8E8.description: Art::  Students will critique and analyze depictions of the Holy Spirit in religious art, focusing on how artists convey His guiding and transformative nature.

37329766A1C2491A8ECD846258A743F7.description: Art::  Students will incorporate advanced artistic techniques and biblical symbolism to depict the Holy Spirit’s presence and work.

73FE1B3020C04945B30809D20BD32F64.description: Art::  Students will create a conceptual or large-scale artwork exploring the Holy Spirit’s role in empowering and transforming believers.

8F72BE5AED584E78BE16E6F752FADF04.description: The Holy Spirit:  Develop an understanding of the Holy Spirit’s presence and work, including His role in guiding, empowering, and transforming believers to live according to God’s will.

984FE40DD6D84F3395529D583FBF6887.description: Library:  Students will verbalize how they intend to honor Jesus and His sacrifice through the books they have chosen.

387683CC3ACE4108B2682DCA199258C7.description: Library:  Students will evaluate Christian writings and allegories, such as Paradise Lost or Mere Christianity, that emphasize Jesus’ role as Redeemer.

BC23E62A3EE743198D7186FAD74ED705.description: Library:  Students will research and present the significance of Jesus’ crucifixion and resurrection in Christian theology and its representation in literature and art.

4692EE5881AE490E8637315437E51AE3.description: Library:  Students will study and analyze key biblical texts about Jesus’ life, teachings, and sacrifice, such as John 1:1-14, Philippians 2:5-11, and Matthew 5-7.

56E89C2EB369485BA74765E221083EFB.description: Art:  Students will verbalize how they created a symbol of love and Jesus in their art.

D0F4F57EE4CE4E3C84351DF94F2C8CA8.description: Art:  Students will critique and analyze historical and contemporary artworks depicting Jesus, focusing on how they convey His role as the Son of God, Savior, and Redeemer.

1FBA977C3DC54ABC85AA09F5BE94D5E6.description: Art:  Students will incorporate advanced artistic techniques and biblical symbolism to reflect Jesus’ role in redemption.

1850B7ECEA444E6BB77B0616DB3E471D.description: Art:  Students will create a conceptual or large-scale artwork exploring the theological and personal implications of Jesus’ life, teachings, and sacrifice.

B1F6FCE13A0342EA8E60839EFABA0DC2.description: Jesus Christ:  Develop an understanding of Jesus Christ as the Son of God, Savior, and Redeemer, focusing on His life teachings, sacrifice, and role in God’s redemptive plan.

66EB2CCE0143424FBDD415A84CCF8F49.description: Library: Students will verbalize how they intend to give God glory through the books they have chosen.

ACB8A5F5F63340A4B2857B7A9A9DED3C.description: Library: Students will evaluate theological works and allegories (e.g., The Chronicles of Narnia) that emphasize God’s sovereign rule over creation.

020440D6C70A422C8D939AF8F634C41F.description: Library: Students will research and write a paper or presentation on how Christian literature and art portray God’s role as Creator and Sustainer.

934B4398B00B41279BECA15A558DC7BF.description: Library: Students will study biblical texts that highlight God’s character and attributes (e.g., Job 38-39, Colossians 1:15-20) and connect them to His role in creation.

DA4F1C74951743F78C269036B750CE3B.description: Art: Students will verbalize how they intend to give God glory through the art they have created.

317F11F637E446C4872458209BFEC6A4.description: Art: Students will analyze and present how historical and contemporary artists have depicted God’s attributes and relationship with creation.

C4D5A8628295405299D944D7A816C8D5.description: Art: Students will use advanced techniques and biblical symbolism to communicate the themes of God’s power, love, and sovereignty.

54C1ABD7125344789A9172433970C202.description: Art:  Students will create a large-scale artwork or conceptual piece that explores God’s character as Creator, Sustainer, and Sovereign Lord.

EF9F6667875B4C66BDA77F8E6EAA7FC2.description: God the Father: Develop an understanding of God’s character, attributes, and relationship with creation, emphasizing His role as Creator, Sustainer, and Sovereign Lord.

BBAB2600547B48C4AFA7719B93608A6E.description: Library:Students will share how the theme of forgiveness and renewal are found throughout the Bible as truth.

506763CF9E16457FB8B80634A1AD7DFF.description: Library:Students will critically analyze works of Christian literature (e.g., Paradise Regained) and their portrayal of God’s eternal Kingdom and renewal of creation.

4C4AB0CD194247B1A8FD378984F019E1.description: Library:Students will research and present on how literature and art have historically represented God’s promises of restoration and hope.

0289B3E3092746E7B01FBD13923EBFF8.description: Library:  Students will study biblical texts about God’s plan for restoration (e.g., Revelation 22:1-5) and connect them to historical and theological contexts.

014AE8F0F71745C9AD4D3E7EF6830154.description: Art:  Students will verbalize how their work give God glory and shows hope.

407413F47AE74182BC3FF7618BDB8F9E.description: Art:  Students will analyze how artists throughout history have depicted themes of hope, renewal, and restoration in their work.

3272116E5C224F25BAE1FCCC3EA1E8B3.description: Art:  Students will incorporate advanced techniques and symbolic imagery to represent the fulfillment of God’s promises.

1DD50E89325D499DB56A30F58AD684B7.description: Art:  Students will create a large-scale or conceptual artwork that explores the themes of God’s ultimate restoration and eternal Kingdom.

13423D7CD0E54C84BF35CF3B3A7EC957.description: Restoration:  Point to God’s ultimate plan to restore creation and humanity, fostering a vision of hope and renewal through His promises and eternal Kingdom.

18ADCD41C85D4D57BA7EAF67F390C168.description: Library: Students will make a life-to-text connection about a story that shares the theme of redemption.

5B935751A2934AE59B07A11AA5EC774A.description: Library: Students will evaluate works of literature, such as Paradise Regained or other Christian writings, to understand how authors interpret and reflect Jesus’ redemptive work.

3D25553D14F84823B29688127303A9C5.description: Library: Students will research and present the historical and cultural context of Jesus’ life, death, and resurrection, highlighting its impact on humanity.

41EA2C3941834273ADDD4D015757DD9B.description: Library:  Students will analyze the redemptive narrative across the Gospels and other biblical texts, connecting it to broader theological themes.

B77DFB8446444AE085FB07499210BEF1.description: Art:  Students will verbalize how they intend to share the message of redemption through the art they have created.

90774247DB5F4D30AA68819EA32E0E56.description: Art:  Students will critique and analyze contemporary and historical artworks, evaluating how they portray redemption through Jesus’ sacrifice.

6506FA0E15C74013B544A6DF137239B4.description: Art:  Students will incorporate advanced artistic techniques and biblical symbolism to represent Christ’s life, death, and resurrection.

D240E442EB08455785EBB8B05E2A9C57.description: Art:  Students will create a large-scale or conceptual artwork that explores the personal and universal implications of Jesus’ redemptive work.

62532CAC5DE744578D92D831D326329B.description: Redemption:  Explore the redemptive work of Jesus Christ, emphasizing His life, death, and resurrection as the means to reconcile humanity with God.

36D5F350957E4E15A5E5E8EC3F2D22E4.description: Library:  Students will verbalize how they intend to give God glory through the books they have chosen.

7E2F23BDD567466A97C7B5753CE1FE9F.description: Library:  Students will evaluate literary works (e.g., Paradise Lost) that explore the themes of the Fall, discussing the portrayal of sin and redemption.

9BEF3FEDEADD433E8C950235E6F692CF.description: Library:  Students will research and write a paper or presentation on how sin has influenced literature, art, and culture throughout history.

BEDB067C0424477F8EDBC48219532C81.description: Library:  Students will critically analyze the Fall narrative and its theological implications for humanity and creation.

1E347FC8AEC943038B15BED4E67DD12D.description: Art:  Students will verbalize how they intend to give God glory through the art they have created.

90506EFA507740BE92DB8ADA98E89F15.description: Art:  Students will analyze and present on how different artists (historical and contemporary) have addressed themes of sin, disobedience, and redemption in their work.

3225CA09655A45C99ED0F6324FDBF4FA.description: Art:  Students will incorporate symbolic elements and biblical references in their art to communicate the need for redemption.

E5379C214A8A4C27962489DB9B9C851B.description: Art:  Students will create a large-scale artwork or mixed-media piece that explores the Fall’s impact on humanity and creation, emphasizing the contrast between brokenness and hope.

646508CFF0E14E4EB6AC7F38593B9862.description: The Fall:  Examine the impact of sin on humanity and creation, demonstrating the consequences of disobedience and the need for redemption.

31019BAFD9774E2E80518D26C1DD22E1.description: Library:  Students will verbalize how they learn about God's creations through the books they have chosen.

A4E091B42D584C67AD85DDC9002D50B5.description: Library:  Students will evaluate literature that integrates themes of creation, discussing how the authors express God’s power and purpose through storytelling.

FEAEE48130534A11A726D74D2B4A8DD3.description: Library:  Students will research and present on how specific natural phenomena (e.g., ecosystems, the solar system) demonstrate God’s creativity and order.

C0A17F6F62B448E397A81B4BD74FC6B2.description: Library:  Students will analyze biblical texts that highlight God’s intentional design in creation and connect these to scientific or historical discoveries.

69705BB9E7744F169F4BFA8F21BC6574.description: Art:  Students will verbalize how they intend to give God glory to God's creations through the art they have made.

5CF5D1FAF9784F6BAC81DD39C4121E0D.description: Art:  Students will analyze and critique how historical and contemporary artists have incorporated themes of creation and divine design in their work.

4D2529E8F9F643F79035D1EE56F42D45.description: Art:  Students will explore symbolic elements in their art to communicate aspects of God’s power, creativity, and order.

98DD4789541D42C291CD77C568CB0782.description: Art:  Students will create a series of artworks (e.g., paintings, sculptures, mixed media) that depict God’s intentional design in humanity and nature.

62EBB2D63F3F4FB59E35F2AEA28D3E80.description: Creation:  Identify and explain elements of God’s creation, highlighting His power, creativity, and intentional design as foundational to understanding the world and humanity.
